item.description:
MCC Fall 2012 International Film Series

"Jiro Dreams of Sushi" (Japan) – In the basement of a Tokyo office building, 85 year old sushi master Jiro Ono works tirelessly in his world renowned restaurant, Sukiyabashi Jiro. As his son Yoshikazu faces the pressures of stepping into his father's shoes and taking over the legendary restaurant, Jiro relentlessly pursues his lifelong quest to create the perfect piece of sushi. Nominee at Tribeca Film Festival. 81 mins. Documentary. Japanese. Rated PG.

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1772925/

 

Manchester Community College shows a FREE movie each month during the school year, which is followed by a potluck dessert buffet and discussion of the movie led by an MCC professor.
item.how_to_find_us: We gather in the lobby just outside the auditorium.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: FREE Movie @ MCC - "Jiro Dreams of Sushi"
